page.title: 05POPULATION IN SANDWICK
page.content: Sandwick has a population of 680. There are 198 children and young people, 58 of whom are under school age. There are about 90 Senior Citizens. Though stable again these numbers were much higher from the middle to late 1970's with the coming of oil which increased activity at Sumburgh Airport and brought workers and their families to live in Sandwick. People working in Lerwick find Sandwick a convenient place to live. In this way many young couples from other areas make their homes here. On the other hand young people seeking work or further education must leave the community and very often they make their homes elsewhere.
